data.title: PM to tackle disparity at meets
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is scheduled to attend two regional meetings held in Kunming, China, today and tomorrow before travelling to Peru for the Apec summit on Sunday, Jirayu Houngsub, spokesman for the Prime Minister

data.title: PM 'won't meddle' in Thaksin probe
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra gave assurances yesterday that she would not interfere in an ongoing probe into claims that her father, former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, was given privileged treatment during his detention at the Police General Hospital (PGH).

data.title: Stats reveal secondhand smoke dangers
data.description: Thailand ranks fifth in the world for having the highest number of female victims of secondhand smoke, whose risk of developing breast cancer is 1.24 times higher than those living in tobacco-free environments, according to a health expert.

data.title: Calls for assembly to draft new charter
data.description: The coalition parties have agreed that a constitutional drafting assembly (CDA) should be established and any changes it recommends must genuinely benefit the people, according to the Bhumjaithai (BJT) Party.

data.title: Boy student dies during running 'test'
data.description: PHICHIT: A Matthayom 4 (Grade 10) student died after a fitness test during a physical education class on Monday.

data.title: PM tackles disputed sea area
data.description: The government expects to form a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) in the next two weeks to negotiate issues related to overlapping maritime area ownership dispute with Cambodia, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said.

data.title: Activists flag reservoir risks
data.description: A group of environmentalists has asked a House committee to investigate two reservoir construction projects which they say could pose a threat to the Dong Phayayen–Khao Yai Forest Complex, a Unesco World Heritage site.

data.title: Moo Deng ‘predicts’ Trump win
data.description: As Americans vote for their next president, the superstar baby pygmy hippo  Moo Deng  has predicted former president  Donald Trump  will win the election.

data.title: Pattaya clears beachfront of jet skis
data.description: CHON BURI - Pattaya City and the Marine Department have launched "Better Pattaya Bay" - aimed at improving the management of speedboat, jet ski and banana boat services along Pattaya Beach.

data.title: Thai winter 'won't be as cold this year'
data.description: Thailand’s  winter  will not be very cold this year, with temperatures about one degree Celsius higher than the average, according to the  Meteorological Department .

data.title: People's Party rejects 'not doing opposition duty' jibe
data.description: The People

data.title: Tariffs likely if Trump wins, warn experts
data.description: The business and academic sectors can foresee scenarios in which the result of the upcoming  United States presidential election  between Democratic candidate  Kamala Harris  and Republican candidate  Donald Trump  could create both risks and opportunities for Thailand.

data.title: PP rejects 'not doing opposition duty' jibe
data.description: The People

data.title: PTP pushing to  cut vote threshold
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party (PTP) is seeking to reduce the size of the majority required to pass a referendum on the constitution.

data.title: Panel to look into Thaksin's hospital stay
data.description: A House committee will meet on Thursday to look into claims that former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra was given privileged treatment during his detention at the Police General Hospital (PGH).

data.title: Pheu Thai's legal eagles urge charter compromise
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has not ruled out the possibility of amending the  charter  in time for the next election as long as certain compromises can be agreed upon.

data.title: Election Commission vows justice in Thaksin case
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) said on Thursday that justice will be assured for all parties involved in petitions against former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, who stands accused of exerting influence over the ruling Pheu Thai Party.

data.title: Most Thais think govt will survive until term ends: poll
data.description: Most Thai people are of the opinion that the government of Prime Minister Paetongtarn “Ung Ing” Shinawatra will be able to last until the end of its mandate in four years

data.title: EC vows justice in Thaksin case
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) said on Thursday that justice will be assured for all parties involved in petitions against former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, who stands accused of exerting influence over the ruling Pheu Thai Party.

data.title: Hopes dim for new constitution before 2027
data.description: A new  constitution  is unlikely to be completed before the government’s term ends in less than three years, meaning it will not be in place by the next general election, says the secretary of the joint House-Senate panel on the charter referendum bill.

data.title: Poll body to seek senator’s dismissal
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) will ask the Constitutional Court to disqualify  Somchai Lenglak  as a senator after a court barred him from taking part in elections for 10 years for an earlier  vote-buying  offence, a source said on Thursday.

data.title: Opposition wants to cancel Thaksin's joint resources MoU with Cambodia
data.description: The opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) wants Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra to revoke a  2001 memorandum of understanding  between Thailand and Cambodia on  joint development  of oil and gas resources in a  disputed area  of the Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: Minister counters push to void MoU with Cambodia
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai denounced a move by political activists to petition the Constitutional Court to revoke a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) between Thailand and Cambodia, established during the administration of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.

data.description: The main opposition People

data.title: Debate on charter rewrite bills in next House session
data.description: Parliament will debate charter amendment bills when it convenes its next session in December, House Speaker Wan Muhammad Noor Matha confirmed on Monday.

data.description: The Election Commission (EC) said on Thursday that justice will be assured for all parties involved in petitions against former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, who stands accused of exerting influence over the ruling Pheu Thai Party.
